issue.title: THE ISSUE
issue.aside: Tuberculosis (TB) remains a major global public health problem.
bodyArr: Despite TB being largely curable, we still see millions of preventable deaths each year due to the disease.
Adherence to a treatment regimen is critical for TB patients, but obstacles such as treatment length, social stigma, and poverty often get in the way of successful treatment.

facts.sub: people are infected with latent TB

existingTreatments.title: EXISTING TREATMENTS
existingTreatments.aside: Current TB treatments fail to reach their full potential.
bodyArr: The World Health Organization currently recommends the DOTS (Directly Observed Treatment, Short-Course) treatment strategy, where patients are observed while taking their medication. Despite the adoption of DOTS, however, TB case rates in many countries are either stagnant or decreasing more slowly than expected.
New patient-centered strategies are needed in order to drive long-term improvement in TB treatment outcomes.
